channel.title: fictionaries on the papers
channel.description: Recent content in fictionaries on the papers

item.title: sigrid
item.description: When I met her, she knew I had this power to go back in time with my camera. She’d let me have whatever I needed as long as when I went back, I photographed Sigrid.

item.title: chelbur
item.description: When they’d pull up to the mail box, she’d come running out from under the pool deck pretending to chase after something. Probably a squirrel.

item.title: number one dad
item.description: There’s a kind of peace that comes in the autumn. The air smells clearer and feels crisp. Being swallowed up in a quilted duster made just for the wedding, and sipping good pour-over

item.title: simple and easy
item.description: When you put the potatoes in the pot, just go ahead and turn it on high. You’re just boiling them, they ain’t gon’ burn. You need some salt and sometimes I’ll go ahead and throw in some pepper.

item.title: a bird of haunting mystery
item.description: In Two-Thousand Eleven, I took a small vacation to Connecticut. Just north of New Haven there’s a wonderful pond with a bridge that cuts right through.

item.title: the sconce
item.description: When the light turns on, everything within a two foot radius illuminates with a warm, candlelight color. The desk’s antique brown stain shimmers, the pages of the notebook turn caramel, and the wall tapestry marries forest green tones with light

item.title: yesterday
item.description: Since yesterday, I’ve been unable to explain what it is I mean to say. In fact, I’ve been saying things that I don’t mean to say at all.

item.title: parker house rolls cafe
item.description: We’d head there every other Sunday right after church. It seemed like it was one of Don’s favorites as much as it was my grandsons. They both liked something about circling what they wanted on the menu and handing it off to the waitress.
